description: From French bédégar, from Persian بادورد‎ or بادآورد‎, properly a kind of white thorn or thistle. From باد‎ (bâd, “wind”) + ورد‎ (vard, “rose”).

entries.meaning: (archaic) A gall produced on rosebushes, especially on the sweetbrier or eglantine, by a puncture from the ovipositor of a gallfly (Diplolepis rosae), and once supposed to have medicinal properties.
